metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6836 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ms_escher_get_data function in plugins/excel/ms-escher.c in GNOME Office Gnumeric before 1.12.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted xls file with a crafted length value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gnumeric - 1.12.9-1
gnumeric - 1.12.9-1
gnumeric-common - 1.12.9-1
gnumeric-plugins-extra - 1.12.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnumeric package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.9-1').
